attributes.action: not coerce young people into obtaining ID cards.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We want to see that ID cards are NOT introduced using coercion tactics for students and young people. 
Student Loans, Bank accounts, Driving Licenses etc., should be available to them without first having to spend £100 on an ID card.
Young people depend on these services to forward their career/education and cannot afford the expense or the risk (through ID theft) of an ID card. Effectively forcing young people into this will only anger them and will result in alienating the younger generation from the rest of society.  
We ask you, as our PM, to re-consider very carefully what you are doing, and, if ID cards have to be introduced, do it on a complete, national scheme. Dont just target a specific group.

rejection.details: Government proposals have not yet been published. We do not accept petitions on hypothetical and potentially false assertions.
reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
